Paper.Title: Sydney, July 2006. c(c)2006 Association for Computational Linguistics An Account for Compound Prepositions in Farsi

Section.Paragraph: There are some sorts of 'Preposition + Noun' combinations in Farsi that apparently a Prepositional Phrase almost behaves as Compound Prepositions. As they are not completely behaving as compounds, it is doubtful that the process of word formation is a morphological one.

The analysis put forward by this paper proposes "incorporation" by which an N o is incorporated to a P o constructing a compound preposition. In this way tagging prepositions and parsing texts in Natural Language Processing is defined in a proper manner.
